27public int utf_mode = 0;
28
29/*
30 * Predefined character sets,
31 * selected by the LESSCHARSET environment variable.
32 */
33struct charset {
34 char *name;
35 int *p_flag;
36 char *desc;
37} charsets[] = {
38 { "ascii", NULL, "8bcccbcc18b95.b" },
39 { "utf-8", &utf_mode, "8bcccbcc18b95.b126.bb" },
40 { "iso8859", NULL, "8bcccbcc18b95.33b." },

42 { "arabic", NULL, "8bcccbcc18b95.33b.3b.7b2.13b.3b.b26.5b19.b" },

63 */

66 char *oname;
67} cs_aliases[] = {
68 { "UTF-8", "utf-8" },
69 { "ANSI_X3.4-1968", "ascii" },
70 { "US-ASCII", "ascii" },

73 { "latin9", "iso8859" },
74 { "ISO-8859-15", "iso8859" },
75 { "latin2", "iso8859" },
76 { "ISO-8859-2", "iso8859" },
77 { "ISO-8859-3", "latin3" },
78 { "latin4", "iso8859" },
79 { "ISO-8859-4", "iso8859" },
80 { "cyrillic", "iso8859" },
81 { "ISO-8859-5", "iso8859" },
82 { "ISO-8859-6", "arabic" },
83 { "ISO-8859-7", "greek" },
84 { "IBM9005", "greek2005" },
85 { "ISO-8859-8", "hebrew" },
86 { "latin5", "iso8859" },
87 { "ISO-8859-9", "iso8859" },
88 { "latin6", "iso8859" },
89 { "ISO-8859-10", "iso8859" },
90 { "latin7", "iso8859" },
91 { "ISO-8859-13", "iso8859" },
92 { "latin8", "iso8859" },
93 { "ISO-8859-14", "iso8859" },
94 { "latin10", "iso8859" },
95 { "ISO-8859-16", "iso8859" },
96 { "IBM437", "dos" },
97 { "EBCDIC-US", "ebcdic" },

99 { "KOI8-R", "koi8-r" },
100 { "KOI8-U", "koi8-r" },
101 { "GEORGIAN-PS", "georgianps" },
102 { "TCVN5712-1", "tcvn" },
103 { "NEXTSTEP", "next" },
104 { "windows", "windows-1252" }, /* backward compatibility */
105 { "CP1251", "windows-1251" },
106 { "CP1252", "windows-1252" },
107 { "CP1255", "windows-1255" },
108 { NULL, NULL }

110
111#define IS_BINARY_CHAR 01
112#define IS_CONTROL_CHAR 02
113
114static char chardef[256];
115static char *binfmt = NULL;
116static char *utfbinfmt = NULL;
117public int binattr = AT_STANDOUT;
118
119static void ichardef __P((char *));
120static int icharset __P((char *, int));
121static void ilocale __P((void));
122
123/*
124 * Define a charset, given a description string.
125 * The string consists of 256 letters,
126 * one for each character in the charset.
127 * If the string is shorter than 256 letters, missing letters
128 * are taken to be identical to the last one.
129 * A decimal number followed by a letter is taken to be a
130 * repetition of the letter.
131 *
132 * Each letter is one of:
133 * . normal character
134 * b binary character
135 * c control character
136 */
137 static void
138ichardef(s)
139 char *s;
140{
141 register char *cp;
142 register int n;
143 register char v;
144
145 n = 0;
146 v = 0;
147 cp = chardef;
148 while (*s != '\0')
149 {
150 switch (*s++)
151 {
152 case '.':
153 v = 0;
154 break;
155 case 'c':
156 v = IS_CONTROL_CHAR;
157 break;
158 case 'b':
159 v = IS_BINARY_CHAR|IS_CONTROL_CHAR;
160 break;
161
162 case '0': case '1': case '2': case '3': case '4':
163 case '5': case '6': case '7': case '8': case '9':
164 n = (10 * n) + (s[-1] - '0');
165 continue;
166
167 default:
168 error("invalid chardef", NULL_PARG);
169 quit(QUIT_ERROR);
170 /*NOTREACHED*/
171 }
172
173 do
174 {
175 if (cp >= chardef + sizeof(chardef))
176 {
177 error("chardef longer than 256", NULL_PARG);
178 quit(QUIT_ERROR);
179 /*NOTREACHED*/
180 }
181 *cp++ = v;
182 } while (--n > 0);
183 n = 0;
184 }
185
186 while (cp < chardef + sizeof(chardef))
187 *cp++ = v;
188}
189
190/*
191 * Define a charset, given a charset name.
192 * The valid charset names are listed in the "charsets" array.
193 */
194 static int
195icharset(name, no_error)
196 register char *name;
197 int no_error;
198{
199 register struct charset *p;
200 register struct cs_alias *a;
201
202 if (name == NULL || *name == '\0')
203 return (0);
204
205 /* First see if the name is an alias. */
206 for (a = cs_aliases; a->name != NULL; a++)
207 {
208 if (strcmp(name, a->name) == 0)
209 {
210 name = a->oname;
211 break;
212 }
213 }
214
215 for (p = charsets; p->name != NULL; p++)
216 {
217 if (strcmp(name, p->name) == 0)
218 {
219 ichardef(p->desc);
220 if (p->p_flag != NULL)
221 *(p->p_flag) = 1;
222 return (1);
223 }
224 }
225
226 if (!no_error) {
227 error("invalid charset name", NULL_PARG);
228 quit(QUIT_ERROR);
229 }
230 return (0);
231}
232
233#if HAVE_LOCALE
234/*
235 * Define a charset, given a locale name.
236 */
237 static void
238ilocale()
239{
240 register int c;
241
242 for (c = 0; c < (int) sizeof(chardef); c++)
243 {
244 if (isprint(c))
245 chardef[c] = 0;
246 else if (iscntrl(c))
247 chardef[c] = IS_CONTROL_CHAR;
248 else
249 chardef[c] = IS_BINARY_CHAR|IS_CONTROL_CHAR;
250 }
251}
252#endif
253
254/*
255 * Define the printing format for control (or binary utf) chars.
256 */
257 static void
258setbinfmt(s, fmtvarptr, default_fmt)
259 char *s;
260 char **fmtvarptr;
261 char *default_fmt;
262{
263 if (s && utf_mode)
264 {
265 /* It would be too hard to account for width otherwise. */
266 char *t = s;
267 while (*t)
268 {
269 if (*t < ' ' || *t > '~')
270 {
271 s = default_fmt;
272 goto attr;
273 }
274 t++;
275 }
276 }
277
278 /* %n is evil */
279 if (s == NULL || *s == '\0' ||
280 (*s == '*' && (s[1] == '\0' || s[2] == '\0' || strchr(s + 2, 'n'))) ||
281 (*s != '*' && strchr(s, 'n')))
282 s = default_fmt;
283
284 /*
285 * Select the attributes if it starts with "*".
286 */
287 attr:
288 if (*s == '*')
289 {
290 switch (s[1])
291 {
292 case 'd': binattr = AT_BOLD; break;
293 case 'k': binattr = AT_BLINK; break;
294 case 's': binattr = AT_STANDOUT; break;
295 case 'u': binattr = AT_UNDERLINE; break;
296 default: binattr = AT_NORMAL; break;
297 }
298 s += 2;
299 }
300 *fmtvarptr = s;
301}
302
303/*
304 *
305 */
306 static void
307set_charset()
308{
309 char *s;
310
311 /*
312 * See if environment variable LESSCHARSET is defined.
313 */
314 s = lgetenv("LESSCHARSET");
315 if (icharset(s, 0))
316 return;
317
318 /*
319 * LESSCHARSET is not defined: try LESSCHARDEF.
320 */
321 s = lgetenv("LESSCHARDEF");
322 if (s != NULL && *s != '\0')
323 {
324 ichardef(s);
325 return;
326 }
327
328#if HAVE_LOCALE
329#ifdef CODESET
330 /*
331 * Try using the codeset name as the charset name.
332 */
333 s = nl_langinfo(CODESET);
334 if (icharset(s, 1))
335 return;
336#endif
337#endif
338
339#if HAVE_STRSTR
340 /*
341 * Check whether LC_ALL, LC_CTYPE or LANG look like UTF-8 is used.
342 */
343 if ((s = lgetenv("LC_ALL")) != NULL ||
344 (s = lgetenv("LC_CTYPE")) != NULL ||
345 (s = lgetenv("LANG")) != NULL)
346 {
347 if ( strstr(s, "UTF-8") != NULL || strstr(s, "utf-8") != NULL
348 || strstr(s, "UTF8") != NULL || strstr(s, "utf8") != NULL)
349 if (icharset("utf-8", 1))
350 return;
351 }
352#endif
353
354#if HAVE_LOCALE
355 /*
356 * Get character definitions from locale functions,
357 * rather than from predefined charset entry.
358 */
359 ilocale();
360#if MSDOS_COMPILER
361 /*
362 * Default to "dos".
363 */
364 (void) icharset("dos", 1);
365#else
366 /*
367 * Default to "latin1".
368 */
369 (void) icharset("latin1", 1);
370#endif
371#endif
372}
373
374/*
375 * Initialize charset data structures.
376 */
377 public void
378init_charset()
379{
380 char *s;
381
382#if HAVE_LOCALE
383 setlocale(LC_ALL, "");
384#endif
385
386 set_charset();
387
388 s = lgetenv("LESSBINFMT");
389 setbinfmt(s, &binfmt, "*s<%02X>");
390
391 s = lgetenv("LESSUTFBINFMT");
392 setbinfmt(s, &utfbinfmt, "<U+%04lX>");
393}
394
395/*
396 * Is a given character a "binary" character?
397 */
398 public int
399binary_char(c)
400 LWCHAR c;
401{
402 if (utf_mode)
403 return (is_ubin_char(c));
404 c &= 0377;
405 return (chardef[c] & IS_BINARY_CHAR);
406}
407
408/*
409 * Is a given character a "control" character?
410 */
411 public int
412control_char(c)
413 LWCHAR c;
414{
415 c &= 0377;
416 return (chardef[c] & IS_CONTROL_CHAR);
417}
418
419/*
420 * Return the printable form of a character.
421 * For example, in the "ascii" charset '\3' is printed as "^C".
422 */
423 public char *
424prchar(c)
425 LWCHAR c;
426{
427 /* {{ This buffer can be overrun if LESSBINFMT is a long string. }} */
428 static char buf[32];
429
430 c &= 0377;
431 if ((c < 128 || !utf_mode) && !control_char(c))
432 SNPRINTF1(buf, sizeof(buf), "%c", (int) c);
433 else if (c == ESC)
434 strcpy(buf, "ESC");
435#if IS_EBCDIC_HOST
436 else if (!binary_char(c) && c < 64)
437 SNPRINTF1(buf, sizeof(buf), "^%c",
438 /*
439 * This array roughly inverts CONTROL() #defined in less.h,
440 * and should be kept in sync with CONTROL() and IBM-1047.
441 */
442 "@ABC.I.?...KLMNO"
443 "PQRS.JH.XY.."
444 "\\]^_"
445 "......W[.....EFG"
446 "..V....D....TU.Z"[c]);
447#else
448 else if (c < 128 && !control_char(c ^ 0100))
449 SNPRINTF1(buf, sizeof(buf), "^%c", (int) (c ^ 0100));
450#endif
451 else
452 SNPRINTF1(buf, sizeof(buf), binfmt, c);
453 return (buf);
454}
455
456/*
457 * Return the printable form of a UTF-8 character.
458 */
459 public char *
460prutfchar(ch)
461 LWCHAR ch;
462{
463 static char buf[32];
464
465 if (ch == ESC)
466 strcpy(buf, "ESC");
467 else if (ch < 128 && control_char(ch))
468 {
469 if (!control_char(ch ^ 0100))
470 SNPRINTF1(buf, sizeof(buf), "^%c", ((char) ch) ^ 0100);
471 else
472 SNPRINTF1(buf, sizeof(buf), binfmt, (char) ch);
473 } else if (is_ubin_char(ch))
474 SNPRINTF1(buf, sizeof(buf), utfbinfmt, ch);
475 else
476 {
477 int len;
478 if (ch >= 0x80000000)
479 {
480 len = 3;
481 ch = 0xFFFD;
482 } else
483 {
484 len = (ch < 0x80) ? 1
485 : (ch < 0x800) ? 2
486 : (ch < 0x10000) ? 3
487 : (ch < 0x200000) ? 4
488 : (ch < 0x4000000) ? 5
489 : 6;
490 }
491 buf[len] = '\0';
492 if (len == 1)
493 *buf = (char) ch;
494 else
495 {
496 *buf = ((1 << len) - 1) << (8 - len);
497 while (--len > 0)
498 {
499 buf[len] = (char) (0x80 | (ch & 0x3F));
500 ch >>= 6;
501 }
502 *buf |= ch;
503 }
504 }
505 return (buf);
506}
507
508/*
509 * Get the length of a UTF-8 character in bytes.
510 */
511 public int
512utf_len(ch)
513 char ch;
514{
515 if ((ch & 0x80) == 0)
516 return 1;
517 if ((ch & 0xE0) == 0xC0)
518 return 2;
519 if ((ch & 0xF0) == 0xE0)
520 return 3;
521 if ((ch & 0xF8) == 0xF0)
522 return 4;
523 if ((ch & 0xFC) == 0xF8)
524 return 5;
525 if ((ch & 0xFE) == 0xFC)
526 return 6;
527 /* Invalid UTF-8 encoding. */
528 return 1;
529}
530
531/*
532 * Is a UTF-8 character well-formed?
533 */
534 public int
535is_utf8_well_formed(s)
536 unsigned char *s;
537{
538 int i;
539 int len;
540
541 if (IS_UTF8_INVALID(s[0]))
542 return (0);
543
544 len = utf_len((char) s[0]);
545 if (len == 1)
546 return (1);
547 if (len == 2)
548 {
549 if (s[0] < 0xC2)
550 return (0);
551 } else
552 {
553 unsigned char mask;
554 mask = (~((1 << (8-len)) - 1)) & 0xFF;
555 if (s[0] == mask && (s[1] & mask) == 0x80)
556 return (0);
557 }
558
559 for (i = 1; i < len; i++)
560 if (!IS_UTF8_TRAIL(s[i]))
561 return (0);
562 return (1);
563}
564
565/*
566 * Get the value of a UTF-8 character.
567 */
568 public LWCHAR
569get_wchar(p)
570 char *p;
571{
572 switch (utf_len(p[0]))
573 {
574 case 1:
575 default:
576 /* 0xxxxxxx */
577 return (LWCHAR)
578 (p[0] & 0xFF);
579 case 2:
580 /* 110xxxxx 10xxxxxx */
581 return (LWCHAR) (
582 ((p[0] & 0x1F) << 6) |
583 (p[1] & 0x3F));
584 case 3:
585 /* 1110xxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx */
586 return (LWCHAR) (
587 ((p[0] & 0x0F) << 12) |
588 ((p[1] & 0x3F) << 6) |
589 (p[2] & 0x3F));
590 case 4:
591 /* 11110xxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx */
592 return (LWCHAR) (
593 ((p[0] & 0x07) << 18) |
594 ((p[1] & 0x3F) << 12) |
595 ((p[2] & 0x3F) << 6) |
596 (p[3] & 0x3F));
597 case 5:
598 /* 111110xx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx */
599 return (LWCHAR) (
600 ((p[0] & 0x03) << 24) |
601 ((p[1] & 0x3F) << 18) |
602 ((p[2] & 0x3F) << 12) |
603 ((p[3] & 0x3F) << 6) |
604 (p[4] & 0x3F));
605 case 6:
606 /* 1111110x 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx */
607 return (LWCHAR) (
608 ((p[0] & 0x01) << 30) |
609 ((p[1] & 0x3F) << 24) |
610 ((p[2] & 0x3F) << 18) |
611 ((p[3] & 0x3F) << 12) |
612 ((p[4] & 0x3F) << 6) |
613 (p[5] & 0x3F));
614 }
615}
616
617/*
618 * Store a character into a UTF-8 string.
619 */
620 public void
621put_wchar(pp, ch)
622 char **pp;
623 LWCHAR ch;
624{
625 if (!utf_mode || ch < 0x80)
626 {
627 /* 0xxxxxxx */
628 *(*pp)++ = (char) ch;
629 } else if (ch < 0x800)
630 {
631 /* 110xxxxx 10xxxxxx */
632 *(*pp)++ = (char) (0xC0 | ((ch >> 6) & 0x1F));
633 *(*pp)++ = (char) (0x80 | (ch & 0x3F));
634 } else if (ch < 0x10000)
635 {
636 /* 1110xxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx */
637 *(*pp)++ = (char) (0xE0 | ((ch >> 12) & 0x0F));
638 *(*pp)++ = (char) (0x80 | ((ch >> 6) & 0x3F));
639 *(*pp)++ = (char) (0x80 | (ch & 0x3F));
640 } else if (ch < 0x200000)
641 {
642 /* 11110xxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx */
643 *(*pp)++ = (char) (0xF0 | ((ch >> 18) & 0x07));
644 *(*pp)++ = (char) (0x80 | ((ch >> 12) & 0x3F));
645 *(*pp)++ = (char) (0x80 | ((ch >> 6) & 0x3F));
646 *(*pp)++ = (char) (0x80 | (ch & 0x3F));
647 } else if (ch < 0x4000000)
648 {
649 /* 111110xx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx */
650 *(*pp)++ = (char) (0xF0 | ((ch >> 24) & 0x03));
651 *(*pp)++ = (char) (0x80 | ((ch >> 18) & 0x3F));
652 *(*pp)++ = (char) (0x80 | ((ch >> 12) & 0x3F));
653 *(*pp)++ = (char) (0x80 | ((ch >> 6) & 0x3F));
654 *(*pp)++ = (char) (0x80 | (ch & 0x3F));
655 } else
656 {
657 /* 1111110x 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx */
658 *(*pp)++ = (char) (0xF0 | ((ch >> 30) & 0x01));
659 *(*pp)++ = (char) (0x80 | ((ch >> 24) & 0x3F));
660 *(*pp)++ = (char) (0x80 | ((ch >> 18) & 0x3F));
661 *(*pp)++ = (char) (0x80 | ((ch >> 12) & 0x3F));
662 *(*pp)++ = (char) (0x80 | ((ch >> 6) & 0x3F));
663 *(*pp)++ = (char) (0x80 | (ch & 0x3F));
664 }
665}
666
667/*
668 * Step forward or backward one character in a string.
669 */
670 public LWCHAR
671step_char(pp, dir, limit)
672 char **pp;
673 signed int dir;
674 char *limit;
675{
676 LWCHAR ch;
677 int len;
678 char *p = *pp;
679
680 if (!utf_mode)
681 {
682 /* It's easy if chars are one byte. */
683 if (dir > 0)
684 ch = (LWCHAR) ((p < limit) ? *p++ : 0);
685 else
686 ch = (LWCHAR) ((p > limit) ? *--p : 0);
687 } else if (dir > 0)
688 {
689 len = utf_len(*p);
690 if (p + len > limit)
691 {
692 ch = 0;
693 p = limit;
694 } else
695 {
696 ch = get_wchar(p);
697 p += len;
698 }
699 } else
700 {
701 while (p > limit && IS_UTF8_TRAIL(p[-1]))
702 p--;
703 if (p > limit)
704 ch = get_wchar(--p);
705 else
706 ch = 0;
707 }
708 *pp = p;
709 return ch;
710}
711
712/*
713 * Unicode characters data
714 */
715struct wchar_range { LWCHAR first, last; };
716
717/*
718 * Characters with general category values
719 * Mn: Mark, Nonspacing
720 * Me: Mark, Enclosing
721 * Last synched with
722 * <http://www.unicode.org/Public/5.0.0/ucd/UnicodeData-5.0.0d7.txt>
723 * dated 2005-11-30T00:58:48Z
724 */
725static struct wchar_range comp_table[] = {
726 { 0x0300, 0x036F} /* Mn */, { 0x0483, 0x0486} /* Mn */,
727 { 0x0488, 0x0489} /* Me */,
728 { 0x0591, 0x05BD} /* Mn */, { 0x05BF, 0x05BF} /* Mn */,
729 { 0x05C1, 0x05C2} /* Mn */, { 0x05C4, 0x05C5} /* Mn */,
730 { 0x05C7, 0x05C7} /* Mn */, { 0x0610, 0x0615} /* Mn */,
731 { 0x064B, 0x065E} /* Mn */, { 0x0670, 0x0670} /* Mn */,
732 { 0x06D6, 0x06DC} /* Mn */,
733 { 0x06DE, 0x06DE} /* Me */,
734 { 0x06DF, 0x06E4} /* Mn */, { 0x06E7, 0x06E8} /* Mn */,
735 { 0x06EA, 0x06ED} /* Mn */, { 0x0711, 0x0711} /* Mn */,
736 { 0x0730, 0x074A} /* Mn */, { 0x07A6, 0x07B0} /* Mn */,
737 { 0x07EB, 0x07F3} /* Mn */, { 0x0901, 0x0902} /* Mn */,

1077
1078/*
1079 * Double width characters
1080 * W: East Asian Wide
1081 * F: East Asian Full-width
1082 * Unassigned code points may be included when they allow ranges to be merged.
1083 * Last synched with
1084 * <http://www.unicode.org/Public/5.0.0/ucd/EastAsianWidth-5.0.0d2.txt>
1085 * dated 2005-11-08T01:32:56Z
1086 */
1087static struct wchar_range wide_table[] = {
1088 { 0x1100, 0x115F} /* W */, { 0x2329, 0x232A} /* W */,
1089 { 0x2E80, 0x2FFB} /* W */,
1090 { 0x3000, 0x3000} /* F */,
1091 { 0x3001, 0x303E} /* W */, { 0x3041, 0x4DB5} /* W */,
1092 { 0x4E00, 0x9FBB} /* W */, { 0xA000, 0xA4C6} /* W */,
1093 { 0xAC00, 0xD7A3} /* W */, { 0xF900, 0xFAD9} /* W */,
1094 { 0xFE10, 0xFE19} /* W */, { 0xFE30, 0xFE6B} /* W */,
1095 { 0xFF01, 0xFF60} /* F */, { 0xFFE0, 0xFFE6} /* F */,
1096 { 0x20000, 0x2FFFD} /* W */, { 0x30000, 0x3FFFD} /* W */,
1097};
1098
1099 static int
1100is_in_table(ch, table, tsize)
1101 LWCHAR ch;
1102 struct wchar_range table[];
1103 int tsize;
1104{
1105 int hi;
1106 int lo;
1107
1108 /* Binary search in the table. */
1109 if (ch < table[0].first)
1110 return 0;
1111 lo = 0;
1112 hi = tsize - 1;
1113 while (lo <= hi)
1114 {
1115 int mid = (lo + hi) / 2;
1116 if (ch > table[mid].last)
1117 lo = mid + 1;
1118 else if (ch < table[mid].first)
1119 hi = mid - 1;
1120 else
1121 return 1;
1122 }
1123 return 0;
1124}
1125
1126/*
1127 * Is a character a UTF-8 composing character?
1128 * If a composing character follows any char, the two combine into one glyph.
1129 */
1130 public int
1131is_composing_char(ch)
1132 LWCHAR ch;
1133{
1134 return is_in_table(ch, comp_table, (sizeof(comp_table) / sizeof(*comp_table)));
1135}
1136
1137/*
1138 * Should this UTF-8 character be treated as binary?
1139 */
1140 public int
1141is_ubin_char(ch)
1142 LWCHAR ch;
1143{
1144 return is_in_table(ch, ubin_table, (sizeof(ubin_table) / sizeof(*ubin_table)));
1145}
1146
1147/*
1148 * Is this a double width UTF-8 character?
1149 */
1150 public int
1151is_wide_char(ch)
1152 LWCHAR ch;
1153{
1154 return is_in_table(ch, wide_table, (sizeof(wide_table) / sizeof(*wide_table)));
1155}
1156
1157/*
1158 * Is a character a UTF-8 combining character?
1159 * A combining char acts like an ordinary char, but if it follows
1160 * a specific char (not any char), the two combine into one glyph.
1161 */
1162 public int
1163is_combining_char(ch1, ch2)
1164 LWCHAR ch1;
1165 LWCHAR ch2;
1166{
1167 /* The table is small; use linear search. */
1168 int i;
1169 for (i = 0; i < sizeof(comb_table)/sizeof(*comb_table); i++)
1170 {
1171 if (ch1 == comb_table[i].first &&
1172 ch2 == comb_table[i].last)
1173 return 1;
1174 }
1175 return 0;
1176}
